metadata.title: CVE-2024-8900 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could write data to the user's clipboard, bypassing the userprompt, during a certain sequence of navigational events. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 129.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-8900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 129.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 129.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 129.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '129.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
